paper_abstract: This paper presents a new way to compute the Delaunay triangulation of a planar set P of n points, using sweep-circle technique combined with the standard recursive edge-flipping. The algorithm sweeps the plane by an increasing circle whose center is a fixed point in the convex hull of P. Empirical results and comparisons show that it reduces the number of in-circle tests and edge-flips, and it is efficient in practice. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: A faster circle-sweep Delaunay triangulation algorithm
